title: Introduction to Full-Text Search
body: Full-text search is a technique for searching text within documents. Unlike simple pattern matching, full-text search uses linguistic analysis to find relevant matches even when exact words don't appear.

title: SeekStorm Performance Benchmarks
body: SeekStorm achieves sub-millisecond query latency with SIMD acceleration. Benchmarks show 7x faster query performance compared to traditional search engines, with support for billion-scale indices.

title: Building a Search API with Rust
body: Learn how to build a high-performance search API using Rust and SeekStorm. This tutorial covers index creation, document ingestion, and query handling with the REST API.

title: Groupware Email Integration
body: Integrating email search into your groupware platform enables users to quickly find messages, attachments, and conversations. This guide covers indexing email content with SeekStorm.

title: Faceted Search Implementation
body: Faceted search allows users to filter results by categories, dates, or other attributes. SeekStorm supports string and numeric range facets for building powerful filter interfaces.

title: Real-Time Indexing Best Practices
body: SeekStorm provides true real-time indexing with incremental updates. Documents become searchable immediately after insertion without requiring a full index rebuild.

title: Multi-Tenant Search Architecture
body: Deploy SeekStorm as a multi-tenant search service with API key management. Each tenant gets isolated indices while sharing the same server infrastructure for cost efficiency.

title: PDF Document Indexing
body: SeekStorm can extract and index text from PDF documents. Configure the PDF feature flag during build to enable document ingestion from file uploads or URLs.

title: Fuzzy Search and Typo Tolerance
body: Enable fuzzy search to help users find results even with typos or misspellings. SeekStorm uses edit distance algorithms to match approximate terms.

title: Calendar and Contact Search
body: Index calendar events and contacts alongside emails for a unified groupware search experience. Users can find meetings, attendees, and appointments with a single query.
